issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
When i click FSCK on Router Web UI Utilities, i got errors
{quote}
HTTP ERROR 404
Problem accessing /fsck. Reason:

    NOT_FOUND
Powered by Jetty://
{quote}
I deep into the source code and find that fsck is not supported currently, So i think we should remove FSCK from Router Web UI
fields.summary: RBF: Remove FSCK from Router Web UI, because fsck is not supported currently

[~elgoiri] Thanks. I will try to implement the router fsck

[~elgoiri][~linyiqun] Are you sure we should support FSCK on WebUI? In thousands cluster the FSCK will take a long time(One hour or more), maybe users could not wait for the fsck result on WebUI? Users often run fsck in the background.

bq. Are you sure we should support FSCK on WebUI? In thousands cluster the FSCK will take a long time(One hour or more), maybe users could not wait for the fsck result on WebUI? Users often run fsck in the background.

The same case applies to the Namenode WebUI.
The Router will only increase this problem by the number of subclusters.
In any case, we internally use it quite a lot targeting particular paths not the full namespace.

Regarding FSCK itself, the prototype I posted in [^HDFS-13802.002.patch] just forwards the request to all subclusters.
We should actually parse the path parameter and just forward the proper one.
